            long long N;
            scanf("%lld", &N);

            // Step1: compute ans1
            long long ans1 = 0;
            for (long long i = 1; i <= N; i++) {
                long long q = N / i;
                ans1 += i * q * (q+1) / 2;
            }

            // Step2: compute ans2
            long long ans2 = (ans1 * 2 + 1) / 3;

            // Step3: convert ans2 to string
            char s[25]; // enough for 20 digits
            sprintf(s, "%lld", ans2);
            int len = strlen(s);

            // Step4: frequency array for digits (0-9)
            int freq[10] = {0};

                if (s[i] >= '0' && s[i] <= '9') {
                    freq[s[i]-'0']++;
                }
            }

            // Step5: count the number of digits that have odd frequency
            int odd_count = 0;
            for (int i = 0; i < 10; i++) {
                if (freq[i] % 2 != 0) {
                    odd_count++;
                }
            }

            // Step6: decision
            if (odd_count <= 1) {
                printf("First\n");
            } else {
                if (len % 2 == 0) {
                    printf("Second\n");
                } else {
                    printf("First\n");
                }
            }

        #include <stdio.h>
        #include <string.h>

        int main() {
            long long N;
            scanf("%lld", &N);

            // Step1: compute ans1
            long long ans1 = 0;
            for (long long i = 1; i <= N; i++) {
                long long q = N / i;
                // Note: the expression i * q * (q+1) might be huge? But we are using long long.
                ans1 += i * q * (q+1) / 2;
            }

            // Step2: compute ans2
            long long ans2 = (ans1 * 2 + 1) / 3;

            // Convert ans2 to a string
            char s[25]; 
            sprintf(s, "%lld", ans2);
            int len = strlen(s);

            // Frequency array for digits 0-9
            int freq[10] = {0};
            for (int i = 0; i < len; i++) {
                if (s[i] >= '0' && s[i] <= '9') {
                    freq[s[i]-'0']++;
                }
            }

            int x = 1; // true
            int found_odd = 0;
            for (int i = 0; i < 10; i++) {
                if (freq[i] == 0) continue;
                if (freq[i] % 2 == 1) {
                    if (found_odd) {
                        x = 0;
                        break;
                    } else {
                        found_odd = 1;
                    }
                }
            }

            if (x) {
                printf("First\n");
            } else {
                if (len % 2 == 0) {
                    printf("Second\n");
                } else {
                    printf("First\n");
                }
            }

            return 0;
        }

            long long i = 1;
            while (i <= N) {
                long long q = N / i;
                long long j = N / q;   // j is the maximum index with the same q.

                // Compute the sum of consecutive integers from i to j: 
                long long block_sum = (i + j) * (j - i + 1) / 2;   // note: (j-i+1) is the count

                ans1 += block_sum * q * (q+1) / 2;

                i = j+1;
            }

        But note: the division by 2 in block_sum: 
            The sum of integers from i to j is (i+j)*(j-i+1)/2.

        This is integer? Because either (j-i+1) is even, or (i+j) is even? Actually, it is always integer.

        Similarly, the other division by 2: block_sum * q * (q+1) / 2: 
            q*(q+1) is always even, so it is integer.

        So we are safe.

        We'll use the optimized loop to handle large N.

        Now, the entire program:

            #include <stdio.h>
            #include <string.h>

            int main() {
                long long N;
                scanf("%lld", &N);

                long long ans1 = 0;
                long long i = 1;
                while (i <= N) {
                    long long q = N / i;
                    long long j = N / q;

                    // Sum of consecutive integers from i to j
                    long long block_sum = (i + j) * (j - i + 1) / 2;

                    // The term for the entire block: block_sum * q * (q+1) / 2
                    ans1 += block_sum * q * (q+1) / 2;

                    i = j + 1;
                }

                long long ans2 = (ans1 * 2 + 1) / 3;

                char s[25];
                sprintf(s, "%lld", ans2);
                int len = strlen(s);

                int freq[10] = {0};
                for (int i = 0; i < len; i++) {
                    if (s[i] >= '0' && s[i] <= '9') {
                        freq[s[i]-'0']++;
                    }
                }

                int x = 1; // true
                int found_odd = 0;
                for (int i = 0; i < 10; i++) {
                    if (freq[i] == 0) continue;
                    if (freq[i] % 2 == 1) {
                        if (found_odd) {
                            x = 0;
                            break;
                        } else {
                            found_odd = 1;
                        }
                    }
                }

                if (x) {
                    printf("First\n");
                } else {
                    if (len % 2 == 0) {
                        printf("Second\n");
                    } else {
                        printf("First\n");
                    }
                }

                return 0;
            }

 Let me test with N=5:

        i=1: q = 5/1=5, j = 5/5=1 -> block: [1,1]
            block_sum = (1+1)*(1)/2 = 1.
            term = 1 * 5 * 6 / 2 = 15.
            ans1=15.

        i=2: q=5/2=2, j=5/2=2 -> block: [2,2]
            block_sum = 2.
            term = 2 * 2 * 3 / 2 = 6.
            ans1=21.

        i=3: q=5/3=1, j=5/1=5 -> but wait, j should be min(N, N/q) but we set j=N/q -> then j=5/1=5 -> but we are at i=3? 
            Actually, we are grouping by q. For q=1, the i range is [3,5] because:
                3: 5//3=1, 4: 5//4=1, 5: 5//5=1.
            So j = 5/1 = 5.
            block_sum = (3+5)*(5-3+1)/2 = (8*3)/2 = 24/2=12.
            term = 12 * 1 * 2 / 2 = 12.
            ans1=15+6+12=33.

        So it matches.

        Therefore, we use the optimized loop.

        Note: the while loop condition: i<=N.

        We are done.
